What is radioactivity?
Options: Radioactivity is the spontaneous emission of radiation from the nuclei of certain elements.

Question: Define half-life.
Options: Half-life is the time taken by a radioactive substance to reduce to half of its initial amount.

Question: Explain the types of radioactive decay.
Options: Types of radioactive decay include: 1. Alpha decay: Emission of helium nucleus (2 protons and 2 neutrons). 2. Beta decay: Conversion of neutron to proton with emission of electron. 3. Gamma decay: Emission of high energy electromagnetic radiation. 4. Positron emission: Conversion of proton to neutron with emission of positron.

Question: Describe the applications of radioactivity.
Options: Applications of radioactivity include: 1. Medicine: Cancer treatment diagnosis and sterilization of medical equipment. 2. Agriculture: Development of new varieties of crops and food preservation. 3. Industry: Testing materials and thickness measurement. 4. Power generation: Nuclear power plants using controlled fission. 5. Research: Carbon dating and studying biological processes.
